page.title: 17A SHROPSHIRE FARM - ENSDON
page.content: A typical farm in this area is shown on one of the photographs associated with this block. It lies just north of the A5, near Ensdon. It comprises 200 hectares, usually shared between wheat, barley, potatoes, sugar beet and pasture. 300 Friesian cattle are kept, 150 milkers and 150 growing calves. There are also 50 beef cattle. The family have farmed here for generations. There are 5 men working on the farm which is equipped with four tractors, a combine harvester and a considerable amount of associated machinery. A large grain drier and grain store has been installed on the farm to enable harvesting to continue in difficult weather conditions. This was put to considerable use during the cool, wet summer of 1985 when this data was collected.
